Articles.Content:
My confession being that I've been playing since 1.3.1 and I've never gone to Eve yet...

sad days

anyways what all KSP confessions do you want to get off your back?

The fact that I well failed my first Dres mission because of well launch windows or something. Well you know what, going to Ike instead is still good, right? NO. The separator (not a decoupler) is attached wrong and yeah I have no quicksaves and need to save them- I only have 1 quicksave in Sun orbit well...

My confession is that I actively enjoy making kerbal torture machines, for example a “merry-go-round from hell” powered by Shrimps, which spun around very fast before taking off, then crashing and exploding.
I have spent more time thinking about Kerbal Space Program than actually playing Kerbal Space Program.
I may or may not have once conducted an orbital missile strike on my Duna base because I thought it was funny. No survivors.
My confession even tho I played ksp for 862.4 hours I haven't landed on all the planets recently I landed on Duna. They planets I did land on is Mun, Minmus and Duna

Though I've done all the major missions in the game, my absolute favorite thing is designing launch escape systems and testing them. I had one crew capsule that was buried DEEP inside of a huge 500+ part craft but I made it so the fairings and all the surrounding structures would disassemble to allow the crew to escape. Of course if the stuff inside the fairing was damaged it wouldn't work sometimes but it was super fun nonetheless.
I've bought the game ages ago an spend more time on the forums than in the actual game.
I have 742.9 in KSP, But I haven't gone to Moho, Dres, Ike, Jool, Any of the Joolian Moons, and Eeloo.
I sometimes like to crash my rockets into the VAB because i like to see explosions. I do always revert to VAB or Launch tho.

I have had KSP for about 4 years, and I don't think I have even done even a full Mun landing without using some sort of cheat (Debug menu) besides in the tutorials. It's not that I have failed a ton of times (a couple though), it's just that I haven't really tried to do that much space stuff. I think once in a Career mode game I made it to the Mun in a slightly modified PT Munsplorer with only setting my Kerbin orbit in the debug menu, but I don't remember if I got back to Kerbin cheat-free. Now that I am more confident docking, I will try to do an Apollo 11 style mission to the Mun soon, and then maybe some sort of rover to somewhere.
Never learned how to rendezvous or dock, so got into spaceplanes and gas stations on the Mun and Minmus.  Currently have a gas truck on its way to Duna's moon.  Never landed there tho.
I’m still very bad at rendezvous
I've never bothered to learn precision re-entry and landing on Kerbin. I just land anywhere. Down is down.
Never gone anywhere except kerbin.
After 6 years of playing never have done a Kerballed Eve return mission. Eve still scares the .... out of me.
I've not even opened the game since November 2021. And then it was just to check something.
My confession is that, since the time I discovered how to use docking port/landing wheel/KAL overclocking Kraken drives, 99% of my missions now take place in and around the KSC.
My latest confession is that I haven't actually played the game in months
I haven't played KSP in about a week.
i watched more ksp then playing it

On 4/15/2022 at 5:44 PM, cantab said:

I've never bothered to learn precision re-entry and landing on Kerbin. I just land anywhere. Down is down

SAMEPeople who fly spaceplanes back to ksc are nerds
I can't launch any command pod with a Launch escape system  without making a little joe style test rocket

I am addicted to mods
I spend too much time looking through mods so i can add to the game, just to make the game unplayable and i am forced to unistall some   : (

Edited June 11, 2022 by Davi SDF
I don't remember the last time I played KSP.
